channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8317] Seek returns wrong result with PREFIX_TREE Encoding
item.description:
TestPrefixTreeEncoding#testSeekWithFixedData from the patch could reproduce the bug.

An example of the bug case:
Suppose the following rows:

1.row3/c1:q1/
2.row3/c1:q2/
3.row3/c1:q3/
4.row4/c1:q1/
5.row4/c1:q2/

After seeking the row 'row30', the expected peek KV is row4/c1:q1/, but actual is row3/c1:q1/.

I just fix this bug case in the patch,

Maybe we can do more for other potential problems if anyone is familiar with the code of PREFIX_TREE
item.summary: Seek returns wrong result with PREFIX_TREE Encoding

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
@Chunhui
I am not aware of this Prefix. But one thing i noticed is that,
for batch0_row2* it is behaving bit different for others bit different.

I added the below print stmt to get the above result


 if (hasMoreOfEncodeScanner) {

        System.out.println(encodeSeeker.getKeyValue()+ " #"+collectionScanner.peek());

        if (KeyValue.COMPARATOR.compare(encodeSeeker.getKeyValue(),

            collectionScanner.peek()) != 0) {

          //dumpInputKVSet();

          fail("Expected " + collectionScanner.peek() + " actual "

              + encodeSeeker.getKeyValue() + ", after seeking " + firstOnRow);

        }

      }

If you see for row1* and row3* the behaviour is that row1* is always matched with row2 and row3* always matches with row4.
But for row2* and row4* the matching is happening correctly. Why is it so? I need to read the code to understand what this does. But just observed these things.
Thanks for testing out the PREFIX_TREE guys. I will try to look into this one tonight. Let me know if you find anything else before then.

batch0_row2* it is behaving bit different for others bit different.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan
The generated test data is not completely consecutive (in order to reproduce the bug),


+  private static ByteBuffer generateFixedTestData(

+    for (int i = 0; i < NUM_ROWS_PER_BATCH; ++i) {

+      if (i / 10 % 2 == 1) continue;

Hope it's your doubt point

chunhui shen thanks again for debugging - I hope it didn't take you all day. Your fix looks good.

It was due to missing test coverage that I is added in attached patch v1. I was previously testing only the PrefixTreeArraySearcher.positionAtOrBefore method, but not positionAtOrAfter, which would have revealed the bug.

I modified TestPrefixTreeSearcher.testRandomSeekMisses() to test both methods. There is a simplified test data set in TestRowDataNub.java (was already there) that passes/fails with/without your fix.

Matt Corgan
Thanks for confirming it.

Run HadoopQA first...

This message is automatically generated.

Should be ok to commit both tests. I think it's important to have the fine-grained tests in the prefix-tree module to prove its correctness with the simplest test possible, but those tests only verify the prefix-tree code. Tests in hbase-server can cover all encoding types.

The downside to building up redundant tests in hbase-server is that we will always be afraid to remove them or modify them, creating a maintenance struggle. We should keep it I think, but be conscious of the fact that too course-grained of a test suite may slow us down later.

The new test is a small test. I think we can keep it.


+    Random random = new Random();

Can a seed be used above ? Please also log the seed so that we can reproduce issue if this test ever fails.

Please also log the seed so that we can reproduce issue if this test ever fails.

If the test fails, we will dump all the test KeyValues by TestPrefixTreeEncoding#dumpInputKVSet()
As long as there is a way to find cause of test failure, I am fine.
I think this can be committed.
I will commit patch v3 if no objection

Committed to trunk and 0.95.

Thanks for the review, matt, ted, ram.

Integrated in hbase-0.95-on-hadoop2 #75 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/hbase-0.95-on-hadoop2/75/)

Result = FAILURE
